intro: Barleria bispinosa, commonly known as the two-spined barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or red in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have two small spines at the base. Barleria bispinosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
